About
Athan Bilal is a free software released under the GNU General Public License version 3.0. It uses prayer time calculation code from the Islamic Tools Library released by the Arab Eyes project. Its source is available at github.com/cdjalel/Bilal.\n \n Athan Bilal contains the coordinates of 23784 cities around the world, extracted from the geoname.org site under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 License.\n \n The background image was designed by Freepick and licensed via www.freepick.com.\n \n There might be a slight difference between prayer times displayed here and the real times adopted by the mosques in your city. In such case, please try:\n - first to configure the right calculation method in the location settings.\n - Next, if your town/commune is very close to a big city, try to use its name instead in location settings.\n - Otherwise, send the name of your city (both in english and your local language), its exact coordinates (latitude, longitude and altitude) and its prayer time calculation method to our address: athan.bilal1@gmail.com, so we can fix it.

To measure the price of gold or silver that you own for more than a year, you must calculate its price per 10 grams in your local currency. Each type of gold that you own must be added (according to karat) separately due to the difference in their value. According to Sharia law, the nisab is the minimum amount that a person has for more than a year to be obligated to pay zakat. You can calculate the nisab value in terms of the value of gold or silver. For silver, the nisab is 21 ounces of silver (653.17 grams) or the money equivalent. For gold, the nisab is 3 ounces (85.05 grams) of gold or the money equivalent. There is another type of zakat that Muslims are obligated to pay zakat al-Fitr. This name is given in Islam for alms that are distributed near the end of Ramadan. The value of Zakat Al-Fitr is the same for all people, regardless of their different income. The minimum for zakat is one saa \'(two handfuls) of food, grains, or dried fruit for each family member. Enter the value of the money you want to take out your Zakat to get the result using the Zakat Calculator Zakat Total Price Gold Price Calculate Zakat Price No Zakat Local Price Local Gold Price
Zakat calculation method The first step : The second step : The third step : Add the value of money, real estate and wealth that you have owned for more than a year while subtracting the amount of debts you must pay and the obligations that must be paid. Check again the gold\'s value in your local currency Click on the Calculate your Zakat button, a summary will be issued that tells you whether you are obligated to pay the zakat or not, if you are obligated to pay, the amount to be paid for Zakat will be clear. This value is 2.5% of all your holdings. Information:

إنَّ من أفضل الأعمال الصالحة اليسيرة التي تقرب المسلم إلى ربه جل وعلا الذكرُ. بعض الآيات والأحاديث في فضل الذكر والدعاء والحث عليها : قال تعالى : و قال تعالى : و قال رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم َ: قال رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّم َ: "وَلَذِكْرُ اللَّهِ أَكْبَرُ". "وَسَبِّحُوهُ بُكْرَةً وَأَصِيلًا". "فَاذْكُرُونِي أَذْكُرْكُمْ وَاشْكُرُوا لِي وَلا تَكْفُرُونِ". "يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا اذْكُرُوا اللَّهَ ذِكْراً كَثِيراً". "وَالذَّاكِرِينَ اللَّهَ كَثِيراً وَالذَّاكِرَاتِ أَعَدَّ اللَّهُ لَهُمْ مَغْفِرَةً وَأَجْراً عَظِيماً". "وَاذْكُر رَّبَّكَ كَثِيرًا وَسَبِّحْ بِالْعَشِيِّ وَالْإِبْكَارِ". "الَّذِينَ يَذْكُرُونَ اللَّهَ قِيَامًا وَقُعُودًا وَعَلَىٰ جُنُوبِهِمْ". "فَإِذَا قَضَيْتُم مَّنَاسِكَكُمْ فَاذْكُرُوا اللَّهَ كَذِكْرِكُمْ آبَاءَكُمْ أَوْ أَشَدَّ ذِكْرًا". "يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تُلْهِكُمْ أَمْوَالُكُمْ وَلَا أَوْلَادُكُمْ عَن ذِكْرِ اللَّهِ". "وَاذْكُرْ رَبَّكَ فِي نَفْسِكَ تَضَرُّعاً وَخِيفَةً وَدُونَ الْجَهْرِ مِنْ الْقَوْلِ بِالْغُدُوِّ وَالآصَالِ وَلا تَكُنْ مِنْ الْغَافِلِينَ". "مثل الذي يذكر ربه و الذي لا يذكر ربه مثل الحي و الميت". "ألا أنبئكم بخير أعمالكم و أزكاها عند مليككم و أرفعها في درجاتكم و خير لكم من أنفاق الذهب و الورق و خير لكم من أن تلقوا عدوكم فتضربوا أعناقهم و يضربوا أعناقكم ?، قالو بلى . قال : (ذكر الله تعالى). "يقول الله تعالى : أنا عند ظن عبدي بي ، و أنا معه إذا ذكرني ، فان ذكرني في نفسه ذكرته في نفسي و ان ذكرني في ملأ ذكرته في ملأ خير منهم ، و ان تقرب إلي شبرا تقربت اليه ذراعا و ان تقرب إلى ذراعا تقربت اليه باعا و ان اتاني يمشي أتيته هرولة. "من قعد مقعدا لم يذكر الله فيه كانت عليه من الله تره ، و من أضطجع مضجعا لم يذكر فيه الله كانت عليه ترة". "ما جلس قوم مجلسا لم يذكروا الله فيه ، و لم يصلوا على نبيهم الا كان عليهم ترة فان شاء عذبهم و ان شاء غفر لهم". "ما من قوم يقومون من مجلس لا يذكرون الله فيه الا قاموا عن مثل جيفة حمار و كان لهم حسره". الأذكار تنير للعبد طريقه في دنياه وأخرته وعند الصراط المستقيم الأذكار تعمل على تطهير اللسان وإشغاله بالذكر عن الغيبة والنميمة والقول الفاسد الأذكار تنزل الرحمة والسكينة والراحة والأمان على المسلم وتحفه بالملائكة ذكر الله سبحانه وتعالى يعادل أفضل الأعمال من عتق الرقاب و الجهاد في سبيل الله جل جلاله، وإنفاق المال في سبيله أذكار الصباح و المساء تريح القلب وتنشر الطمأنينة والراحة النفسية في قلب المسلم أذكار الصباح و المساء تساعد المسلم في الابتعاد عن الغفلة عن ذكر الله َالَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَى صَلَاتِهِمْ يُحَافِظُونَ*أُولَئِكَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ مُّكْرَمُونَ إِنَّ الصَّلاةَ كَانَتْ عَلَى الْمُؤْمِنِينَ كِتَاباً مَوْقُوتاً وَأَنْ أَقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَاتَّقُوهُ وَهُوَ الَّذِي إِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَِ يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا اسْتَعِينُوا بِالصَّبْرِ وَالصَّلَاةِ إِنَّ اللَّهَ مَعَ الصَّابِرِينَ وَأَقِمِ الصَّلَاةَ طَرَفَيِ النَّهَارِ وَزُلَفًا مِنَ اللَّيْلِ إِنَّ الْحَسَنَاتِ يُذْهِبْنَ السَّيِّئَاتِ ذَلِكَ ذِكْرَى لِلذَّاكِرِينَ يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا ارْكَعُوا وَاسْجُدُوا وَاعْبُدُوا رَبَّكُمْ وَافْعَلُوا الْخَيْرَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَأَقَامُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَآتَوُا الزَّكَاةَ لَهُمْ أَجْرُهُمْ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ وَلَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ أول ما يُحاسب عليه العبد يوم القيامة الصلاة؛ فصلاحها صلاح لأعماله، وفسادها فساد لأعماله المحافظة على الصلاة في وقتها من أحبّ الأعمال إلى الله تعالى الصّلاة نور وهداية وحُجّة لصاحبها في الدنيا والآخرة عند لقاء الله تعالى الصلاة نور لصاحبها في الدنيا وفي الآخرة الصّلاة أفضل الأعمال عند الله -تعالى- بعد الشهادتين أذكار الصباح أذكار المساء Dohr لتجديد معطيات الصفحة، يجب أن تتصل بالإنترنت جاري تجديد المعطيات ... ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION Allows the API to use WiFi or mobile cell data (or both) to determine the device\'s location. The API returns the location with an accuracy approximately equivalent to a city block. ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION In order to use Wi-Fi P2P for files sharing, official android documentation suggests to add this permission for connection. The Word of Purity (Tayyabah) The word of Testimony (Shahaadat) The word of Glorification (Tumjeed) The word of Unity (Tauhid) The word of Penitence (Astaghfar) The words of rejecting disbelief (Rud-A-Kuffer)
(There is no God but Allah Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah) (I bear witness that no-one is worthy of worship but Allah, the One alone, without partner, and I bear witness that Muhammad is His servant and Messenger) (Glory be to Allah and Praise to Allah, and there is no God But Allah, and Allah is the Greatest. And there is no Might or Power except with Allah.) (There is) none worthy of worship except Allah. He is only One. (There is) no partners for Him. For Him (is) the Kingdom. And for Him (is) the Praise. He gives life and acuses death. And He (is) Alive. He will not die, never, ever. Possessor of Majesty and Reverence. In His hand (is) the goodness. And He (is) the goodness. And He (is) on everything powerful.) (I seek forgiveness from Allah, my Lord, from every sin I committed knowingly or unknowingly, secretly or openly, and I turn towards Him from the sin that I know and from the sin that I do not know. Certainly You, You (are) the knower of the hidden things and the Concealer (of) the mistakes and the Forgiver (of) the sins. And (there is) no power and no strength except from Allah, the Most High, the Most Great) (O Allah! Certainly I seek protection with You from, that I associate partner with You anything and I know it. And I seek forgiveness from You for that I do not know it. I repended from it and I made myself free from disbelief and polytheism and the falsehood and the back-biting and the innovation and the tell-tales and the bad deeds and the blame and the disobedience, all of them. And I submit and I say (there is) none worthy of worship except Allah, Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah.)

tola
Kg
Zakat is applicable on all cash balances and bank balances of 2.5%
Zakat is applicable on all gold but as a pure gold(24-carat) 2.5%. when you calculate zakat as a gold weight enter price of 24-carat(pure gold) gold. this calculate zakat on 22-carat and 18-carat automatically
Zakat is applicable on all silver but as a pure silver(without decorative item, all household item) 2.5%
Zakat is applicable on all investment as firm or separately by owners 2.5%
Zakat is applicable on Property(only rental incomes) 2.5%. However zakat is applied after deducting maintenance and other expenses
Zakat is applicable on all Business(cash, goods/stocks) 2.5%. This is for business person only. No matter what business you are into, you have got to pay zakat on all stoke-in-trade. the stock must be valued at its Landed Cast Price. if you have any bills receivable(sales on credit) then you need to add the same towards calculations.
Zakat is applicable on all Agriculture(fruits, commercially grown flowers, vegetables,all type of grains) at harvest time itself. in agriculture zakat not applied after year. if there are two or more crop on the same land per year, then zakat has to be paid as many times on crop. Crop depend on rain-water 10% zakat, crop depend on irrigation-water 5% zakat and both-water 7.5% zakat
Zakat is applicable on all Cattle(camel, cows, sheeps, goats,broiler chickens) every 40 animals 1 animal zakat. you may wish to give cash as animal price please consult your Scholar or Imaam who can guide you to the right direction
if they have a value, then they calculate towards your wealth, and it is on the wealth that zakat is mandatory. However please consult with Ullema. Most Ullema contentd that a diamond is a piece of corbin and its value varies, unlike that of gold or silver. One may calculate the Saleable Value of Items-at-hand on the date of Zakat Calculation
Zakat is applicable on Loans you have given from friends and relatives. it should be treated as Cash in Hand. if you are in doubt, on the return of your money, then you may not calculate it as your wealth. when you receive your money, then add it your wealth.
if you have any pending tax payable to the govt, as of the date of zakat calculation, then the same may be deducted before arriving at the net worth. if you have taken any loans from any person or institution, and if you have not already deducted the same from any of the above sections, then you can deduct your payable over here. please be truthful, as zakat is a sure way of protecting ones wealth if zakat has been paid on it regularly and fully. LOANS takes only for zakatable-wealth should be deducted. Cars, Houses etc are not zakatable wealth. So any loan/mort-gate taken for these purposes are not to be deducted
Definition Verses Ahadees Types Differences Tawhid
Shirk is to associate someone other than Allah in those aspects which are unique to Allah and His exclusive right. Shirk is to worship created beings like Allah is worshipped, to venerate created beings like Allah must be venerated, and to assign a portion of His divinity to someone else.
Al-maida 05:72 : \nThey are certainly faithless who say, ‘Allah is the Messiah, son of Mary.’ But the Messiah had said, ‘O Children of Israel! Worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord. Indeed whoever ascribes partners to Allah, Allah shall forbid him [entry into] paradise, and his refuge shall be the Fire, and the wrongdoers will not have any helpers.
Az-Zumar 39:65 : \nIt has already been revealed to you [Prophet] and to those before you: ‘If you ascribe any partner to God, all your work will come to nothing: you will be one if the losers.
Al-Mu’jam al-Kabīr 11457 :\nIbn Abbas reported: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said, “Allah Almighty said: Whoever knows that I have power to forgive sins, I will forgive him and I will not mind, as long as he does not associate any partners with me.
Sahih Muslim 2985 : \nAbu Huraira reported Allah\'s Messenger (ﷺ) as stating that Allah the Most High and Exalted said: I am the One, One Who does not stand in need of a partner. If anyone does anything in which he associates anyone else with Me, I shall abandon him with one whom he associates with Allah.
Greater Shirk (Shirk Akbar) : \nGreater Shirk is associating others with Allah in those aspects which are unique to Allah in his person taking a rival or associate unto Allah and making it an equal to Allah. Shirk in Allah Being the Lord.
Lesser Shirk (Shirk Asghar) : \nLesser Shirk is what has been specifically called shirk in the Quran and Sunnah, but does not reach the level of greater shirk. Also, lesser shirk is said to lead to greater shirk. Some scholars have said lesser shirk is so vast that it is difficult to define it precisely.
Riyaa (Showing-Off) : \nThe Messenger of Allah said: “The thing that I fear most for you is lesser shirk.” They said: “O Messenger of Allah, what is lesser shirk?” He said: “Riyaa (showing off), for Allah will say on the Day when people are recompensed for their actions: ‘Go to those for whom you were showing off with your deeds in the world, and see what reward you find with them.’” (Ahmad) Riyaa is to perform worship in order to be seen and praised by people. Riyaa renders a deed void; the person earns sin instead of reward from Allah, and it exposes him to punishment. The greater shirk expels a person from the fold of Islam, whereas the lesser shirk does not take one out of Islam, but reduces one’s belief in Allah. A person who dies committing greater shirk will be in Hellfire for eternity; this is not the case with one committing lesser shirk. Greater shirk wipes out and annuls all good deeds, whereas lesser shirk only ruins the deeds it motivates or is a part of. Greater shirk is not forgiven by Allah except through sincere repentance done before death; whereas it is up to Allah to punish or forgive lesser shirk.
Tawhid, also spelled Tauhid, Arabic Tawḥīd, (“making one,” “asserting oneness”), in Islam, the oneness of God, in the sense that he is one and there is no god but he, as stated in the shahādah (“witness”) formula: “There is no god but God and Muhammad is His prophet. Tawhid further refers to the nature of that God—that he is a unity, not composed, not made up of parts, but simple and uncompounded. The doctrine of the unity of God and the issues that it raises, such as the question of the relation between the essence and the attributes of God, reappear throughout most of Islamic history. In the terminology of Muslim mystics (Sufis), however, tawhid has a pantheistic sense; all essences are divine, and there is no absolute existence besides that of God. To most Muslim scholars, the science of tawhid is the systematic theology through which a better knowledge of God may be reached, but, to the Sufis, knowledge of God can be reached only through religious experience and direct vision.
Az-Zariyat 51:56 : \nAnd I (Allah) created not the jinn and mankind except that they should worship Me (Alone).
Al-An’am 6:151 : \nSay (O Muhammad P.B.U.H): “Come, I will recite what your Lord has prohibited you from: Join not anything in worship with Him.
Sahih al-Bukhārī 7373 : \nSahih Muslim 30 Mu’adh bin Jabal reported: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said, “O Mu’adh, do you know what is the right of Allah upon His servants?” I said, “Allah and His messenger know best.” The Prophet said, “To worship Him alone and to associate none in worship with Him. And do you know what is their right upon Him?” I said, “Allah and His messenger know best.” The Prophet said, “Not to punish them if they do so.”
Al-Sunan al-Kubrā lil-Nasa’i 5760 : \nAbu Huraira reported: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said, “There is no God but Allah, and Allah is the greatest. There is no God but Allah without any partner, there is no God but Allah. To Him belong dominion and praise, there is no God but Allah. There is no power or might but in Allah. Whoever says these words in a day or a night or a month, then he dies in that day or night or month, his sins will be forgiven.” Kalmas Muharram 1236 Ah Oct 24, 2012 Al-Hajj

What is Fasting? Fasting is a direction to Allah Path for Muslim Community. they would be excited for this Fasting Rules sunnah_fasting_rule shia_fasting_rule Sunni Shia
Cautions Prayer Timings Learn Quran 6 kalma Islamic Calendar Fasting Rules How to Pray Prayer (salah; plural salawat) is one of the five pillars of Islam. \n \n It is incumbent upon all mature Muslims, and highly recommended for children aged ten and over, to complete their five daily prayers according to the way the Prophet (PBUH) performed it in order for them to be valid. It is believed that communication with Allah will bring life to the prayerful and bring them courage. \n \nMuslims believe that Allah speaks to us through the Quran, and salaah is our means of connecting to Allah. \n \nWhether you\'re just curious as to how Muslims pray or if you\'re looking to learn for yourself, it\'s never too late to start. Make your intention known in your heart. Before initiating the salat, it is important that you have the intention to pray. Raise your hands up next to your ears and shoulders. Raise your hands up next to your ears and shoulders, then say Allāhu akbar (الله أَكْبَر). This translates to \"Allah is the greatest.\" Do this while standing (or sitting if you can\'t stand). \\n \\nThe fingers should be spaced when the hands are\" +\n \" raised. Place your right hand over your left hand. Place your hands either on your navel, on your chest, or between the two; there\'s a difference of opinion between Islamic schools \" \n \"of thoughts. Keep your eyes focused on the ground. It helps to keep your sight fixed on where your head will rest when \" +\n \"prostrating later. Do not let your eyes wander. \\n \\nRecite the optional Istiftah Du\'a (opening prayer): \\n \\nFollow it \" +\n \"with \" +\n \"Surah Al-Fatiha (this Surah is recited in each Rak\'ah): \\n \\nRecite any other surah or any part of the Qu\'ran, such as \" +\n \"Surah Ikhlas. \\n \\nReciting a surah after Al-Fatiha is only done in the first 2 units (Rakaa\'s) of fardh salat while in \" +\n \"sunnah mu\'akkadah it is done in all units(Rakaa\'s) Say \"Allahu Akbar\" and bend down. Bend your body so that your back and neck are as straight as possible and level with the ground, keeping your eyes focused on the ground and keep your fingers and palm on the knees. Your back and head should be at a 90° angle with your legs. You don\'t need to make a perfect angle; your body should be relaxed. This position is called ruku. Stand back up (raise from ruku). While rising up with your arms beside you. Say Allahu Akbar and prostrate. Place your head, knees and hands on the floor. While \\\"sujood\\\" (prostration) make sure that your forehead and nose touch the ground. This is the position called \\\"sajdah.\\\" Rise from sajdah and sit on your knees. Place your left foot from ball to heel on the floor. Your right foot should be toes on the floor only. Place your hands flat on your knees. Say Allahu akbar and stand up. You have completed one rak\'ah. Depending on the salah, you may need to complete up to three more. \\n \\nIn every second rak\'ah, after the second sajdah, sit on your knee again. Recite: \\n \\nTashahhud \\nDurood Finish the prayer with tasleem. After the tashahhud, durood, and any du\'a you wish to recite, end the prayer by: \\n \\nTurning your head to the right and saying, As-salamu alaykum wa Rahmatullahi. The angel who records your good deeds is to this side. \\n \\nTurning your head to the left and saying, As-salamu alaykum wa Rahmatullahi. The angel who records your wrongful deeds is to this side. The prayers have ended! Prayer (salah; plural salawat) is one of the five pillars of Islam.\\nIt is incumbent upon all mature Muslims, and highly recommended for children aged ten and over, to complete their five daily prayers according to the way the Prophet (PBUH) performed it in order for them to be valid. It is believed that communication with Allah will bring life to the prayerful and bring them courage.\\nMuslims believe that Allah speaks to us through the Qur\'an, and salaah is our means of connecting to Allah.\\nWhether you\'re just curious as to how Muslims pray or if you\'re looking to learn for yourself, it\'s never too late to start. Make your intention known in your heart. Before initiating the salat, it is important that you have the intention to pray. Raise your hands up next to your ears and shoulders. Stand with one\'s feet close together, raising one\'s hands to the level of the shoulders, palms facing the qibla , fingers naturally outspread, with one\'s wrists and forearms covered Place your right hand over your left hand. Stand with one\'s feet close together, raising one\'s hands to the level of the shoulders, palms facing the qibla , fingers naturally outspread, with one\'s wrists and forearms covered. There\'s a difference of opinion between Islamic schools of thoughts. Keep your eyes focused on the ground. It helps to keep your sight fixed on where your head will rest when prostrating later. Do not let your eyes wander.\\n Recite the optional Istiftah Du\'a (opening prayer):\\nFollow it with Surah Al-Fatiha (this Surah is recited in each Rak\'ah) \\n : Recite any other surah or any part of the Qu\'ran, such as Surah Ikhlas.\\nReciting a surah after Al-Fatiha is only done in the first 2 units (Rakaa\'s) of fardh salat while in sunnah mu\'akkadah it is done in all units(Rakaa\'s) Say \"Allahu Akbar\" and bend down. Bend your body so that your back and neck are as straight as possible and level with the ground, keeping your eyes focused on the ground and keep your fingers and palm on the knees. Your back and head should be at a 90° angle with your legs. You don\'t need to make a perfect angle; your body should be relaxed. This position is called ruku. Stand back up (raise from ruku). Stand up completely. Say this supplication in a lowered voice while in the standing position with one\'s gaze fixed on the place of prostration. Say Allahu Akbar and prostrate. Place your head, knees and hands on the floor. While \"sujood\" (prostration) make sure that your forehead and nose touch the ground. This is the position called \"sajdah.\" Rise from sajdah and sit on your knees. Draw both legs to the right side, thighs on top of each other, sitting on the left buttocks, hands on top of thighs such that the tips of the fingers reach the knees, fingers together, and eyes gazing at one\'s lap. Say Allahu akbar and stand up. You have completed one rak\'ah. Depending on the salah, you may need to complete up to three more.\n In every second rak\'ah, after the second sajdah, sit on your knee again. Recite:\nTashahhud Durood Finish the prayer with tasleem. After the tashahhud, durood, and any du\'a you wish to recite, end the prayer by:\nTurning your head to the right and saying, As-salamu alaykum wa Rahmatullahi. The angel who records your good deeds is to this side.\nTurning your head to the left and saying, As-salamu alaykum wa Rahmatullahi. The angel who records your wrongful deeds is to this side. The prayers have ended! Internet not available
